findings_by_domain.finding_summary: SEC examination deficiencies across 5 categories (custody, valuation, cross-trading, allocation, compliance) with certain remediation costs $1.28M-$1.79M
SEC follow-up examination in 2026 probable given deficiency history, estimated cost $750K-$2.0M
Marketing Rule violations (testimonials, composite bias) require remediation, $125K-$275K
ERISA prohibited transaction excise tax risk from cross-trading or allocation errors involving Taft-Hartley plans, $1.0M-$2.5M exposure
Side letter MFN ongoing exposure: 8 investors triggered most-favored-nation fee reduction from 1.5% to 1.25% in 2023, NPV of 7-year ongoing fee loss = $98M (CERTAIN)

Key person redemption wave: Hedge fund LPAs allow redemption if founder/CIO departs or loses control. Fire-sale liquidation of $3.0B AUM at 2-4% discount = $60M-$120M loss, 64.1% probability weighted scenario
Client concentration: State Pension Plan A represents 23% of AUM ($9.8B), $41M annual revenue. 40% probability of termination over 3 years if performance issues or key person event
Herding cascade beyond Plan A: If top client terminates, 2-3 other large institutions may follow (herding behavior), additional $50M-$100M revenue loss NPV

Valuation markdown: Illiquid assets (distressed debt $180M + private equity $180M) marked using stale pricing (18-20 months old). Public comparables down 30-40%. Expected markdown $37M-$104M, base case $65M

Performance fee clawback: If NAV overstated, LPs may demand return of performance fees paid based on inflated valuations. $6M-$13M exposure, 70% probability given sophisticated LP base with MFN side letters
High-water mark recovery delay: If hedge funds fall below HWM post-markdown, no performance fees until recovered. NPV of foregone fees over recovery period (1.5-4 years): $32M-$40M
LP valuation disputes: LPs may challenge markdown or initiate arbitration. Defense costs + settlement exposure $3.5M-$9.5M, 50% probability if markdown exceeds $50M
Data breach exposure: Ransomware attack (22.5% probability, $22.9M-$75.6M cost) + insider threat (5% probability, $1M-$2.3M cost). Combined 27.5% probability weighted scenario
Regulation S-P compliance remediation: December 3, 2025 deadline compliance gaps require remediation, $95K-$190K certain cost
Cyber insurance gap: No cyber insurance coverage in force, $1M-$2.3M uninsured exposure for data breach scenarios
E&O insurance shortfall: Valuation-related claims may exceed $50M E&O policy limits, estimated shortfall $0-$31.8M with 30% probability of material claim
Carried interest recharacterization: IRS Section 1061 may recharacterize long-term capital gains as ordinary income for certain carried interest allocations, $7.96M tax exposure (CERTAIN)
PM retention risk: 1-2 senior portfolio manager departures in Year 1 post-closing (50% probability) would trigger client attrition. NPV of revenue loss: $70M-$185M, base case $127.5M

findings_by_domain.finding_summary: Non-compete 'terminated without cause' risk: Massachusetts Reform Act limits non-compete enforceability if PM terminated without cause. $12M-$16M per PM revenue loss if unenforceable, 30% probability across portfolio

quantification_methodology.probability_methodology: Per-finding analyst estimates based on: (1) industry benchmarks, (2) Pinnacle-specific risk factors, (3) legal/regulatory precedent. Monte Carlo simulation applies correlation adjustments
quantification_methodology.confidence_level: HIGH - All findings sourced from completed specialist reports with detailed quantification methodologies

key_insights: Top 3 risks represent 64% of gross midpoint exposure: Valuation markdown ($70.55M), Side letter MFN ($98M), PM retention ($127.5M)
After probability weighting, top 3 represent 84% of expected value: MFN $98M (certain) + Valuation $70M (60%) + PM retention $63.75M (50%)
High positive correlations limit diversification: Valuation markdown triggers cascade (clawback + HWM delay + LP disputes + SEC scrutiny)
Monte Carlo 75th percentile ($178M) provides target for escrow sizing - covers 75% of simulated scenarios
Correlation adjustment reduces naive additive exposure by $32.3M (7.8%), accounting for overlapping risks
Commercial contracts category dominates: $204.65M weighted (49.8% of total) driven by MFN side letters and client concentration
Time profile: 68% of weighted exposure is ONE_TIME or MULTI_YEAR (resolves within 3 years), supports standard escrow timeline

primary.rationale: Covers Monte Carlo 78th percentile ($178M) with buffer for tail risks. Staged releases align with 3-year resolution timeline for valuation, performance fees, and client relationships.

alternative_1.rationale: Covers expected value ($113M-$135M probability-weighted) plus buffer. Clean transaction, no escrow complexity, but lower protection (~65% scenario coverage).

alternative_2.rationale: Splits risk between holdback and incentive realignment. Earnout restructure adds $40M NAV recovery pool tied to HWM achievement.

not_recommended.reason: Leaves acquirer exposed to $113M-$178M expected/probable exposure without compensation
Underprices risk, covers only 50th percentile, inadequate for correlation cascade effects
Overprices risk beyond 90th percentile, likely deal-breaker, exceeds reasonable probability-weighted exposure
